name: FitzHugh–Nagumo neuron model (limit cycle)
equations: dv/dt = v - v^3/3 - w + I; dw/dt = ε (v + a - b w)
description_simple: A neuroscience model that produces periodic spiking but no chaos in standard regimes.
description_complex: A two-dimensional reduction of the Hodgkin–Huxley neuron model. With typical parameters, the system exhibits a stable limit cycle corresponding to repetitive firing, but lacks positive Lyapunov exponents or strange attractors. It's a critical contrast to chaotic bursting models like Hindmarsh–Rose.
